com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments

Class MDP

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgapcustomised.BulkFitnessFunction
      • com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.AHNIFitnessFunction
        • com.ojcoleman.ahni.evaluation.BulkFitnessFunctionMT
          • com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.MDP
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AHNIEventListener, Configurable, java.io.Serializable

    public class MDP
extends BulkFitnessFunctionMT
implements AHNIEventListener
    A fitness function that generates MDP environments to assess agents against.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static final java.lang.String EVAL_TYPE

      • STATE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA

        public static final java.lang.String STATE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA
        The amount to increase the number of states in the generated environments when the current size has been sufficiently mastered (see DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. If the value is followed by an "x" then the value is considered a factor (and so should be > 1).
        See Also:

        public static final java.lang.String STATE_COUNT_MAX
        The maximum amount to increase the number of states in the generated environments to.
        See Also:

        The initial number of actions available in the generated environments.

      • ACTION_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA
        The amount to increase the available number of actions in the generated environments when the current size has been sufficiently mastered (see DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. If the value is followed by an "x" then the value is considered a factor (and so should be > 1).
        See Also:

        The maximum amount to increase the available number of actions in the generated environments to.
        See Also:

      • ACTION_MAP_RATIO

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_MAP_RATIO
        The proportion of actions that will map to some other state. This is evaluated probabilistically for all states and actions when generating an environment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSITION_REWARD_RATIO

        public static final java.lang.String TRANSITION_REWARD_RATIO
        The proportion of state transitions that will yield a reward value greater than 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRANSITION_RANDOMNESS

        public static final java.lang.String TRANSITION_RANDOMNESS
        The randomness of state transitions. A value of 0 will make state transitions deterministic (purely determined by the action performed), a value of 1 will make transitions completely envRandom (action performed will be ignored).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_COUNT
        The number of environments to evaluate candidates against. Increasing this will provide a more accurate evaluation but take longer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_CHANGE_RATE

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_CHANGE_RATE
        The fraction of environments that should be replaced with new environments per generation. This is evaluated probabilistically.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_INCREASE_RATE

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_INCREASE_RATE
        Factor to increase the total number of environments by when the current environment(s) have been sufficiently mastered (see DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. May be fractional; if the factor is greater than 1 then the number of environments will be increased by at least 1. Default is 1 (no change).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENVIRONMENT_COUNT_MAX

        public static final java.lang.String ENVIRONMENT_COUNT_MAX
        If DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE is greater than 1, then this is the maximum number of environments to increase to. Default is 128.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRIAL_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String TRIAL_COUNT
        The number of trials per environment. If not set or set to <= 0 then this will be set to the grid size if fitness.function.mdp.grid is true and fitness.function.mdp.single_reward_state is true, otherwise to fitness.function.mdp.environment.count if fitness.function.mdp.environment.replacerate is 0, otherwise to fitness.function.mdp.states.maximum * fitness.function.mdp.actions.maximum .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STEPS_PER_TRIAL

        public static final java.lang.String STEPS_PER_TRIAL
        The number of steps in the environment per trial. If not set or set to <= 0 then this will be set depending on the number of trials. If the number of trials is 1 then it will be set to (actionCount * stateCount * stateCount) / trialCount, if the number of trials > 1 then it will be set to stateCount.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOVELTY_SEARCH

        public static final java.lang.String NOVELTY_SEARCH
        If true enables novelty search for which behaviours are defined by the current state for each step of each trial of each environment. Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOVELTY_SEARCH_ENV_COUNT

        public static final java.lang.String NOVELTY_SEARCH_ENV_COUNT
        If set to an integer > 0 then this many environments will be used to characterise an agents behaviour for novelty search. Defaults to fitness.function.mdp.environment.count.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOVELTY_SEARCH_ONLY

        public static final java.lang.String NOVELTY_SEARCH_ONLY
        If true then makes novelty search the only objective. Performance values are still calculated. Default is false. If true then fitness.function.mdp.noveltysearch is also forced to true.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENV_RANDOM_SEED

        public static final java.lang.String ENV_RANDOM_SEED
        Seed to use to generate and simulate environments.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT_INCLUDE_PREVIOUS_ACTION

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT_INCLUDE_PREVIOUS_ACTION
        Whether to include the previously performed action in the input to the agent. Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT_INCLUDE_PREVIOUS_STATE

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT_INCLUDE_PREVIOUS_STATE
        Whether to include the previous state in the input to the agent. Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT_INCLUDE_EXPL

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT_INCLUDE_EXPL
        Whether to include an input that indicates whether the agent should be exploring to learn about the environment or exploiting the knowledge its learnt. Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRID_ENVIRONMENT

        public static final java.lang.String GRID_ENVIRONMENT
        Whether to generate environments where the states are organised in a grid. The number of states is forced to (ceil(sqrt(state_count)))^2. The number of actions is forced to 4 and each action will move the agent to a neighbouring state. The input to the agent is the row and column index of the current state (1-of-N encoding for each). The environments are forced to be deterministic (no transition randomness). The grid wraps around (is a toroidal grid). Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRID_ENVIRONMENT_WRAP

        public static final java.lang.String GRID_ENVIRONMENT_WRAP
        Whether to make the grid toroidal (wrap around at edges). Default is false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SINGLE_REWARD_STATE

        public static final java.lang.String SINGLE_REWARD_STATE
        Whether there should be a single state which when reached yields a reward value of 1 (rather than any transition to any state yielding a randomly generated reward value according to fitness.function.mdp.transition.reward.ratio.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • initialiseEvaluation

        public void initialiseEvaluation()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        If required, initialise data for the current evaluation run. This method is called at the beginning of BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List). It should be overridden if data (eg input and/or output patterns) need to be set-up before every evaluation run.
        Overrides:
        initialiseEvaluation in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

      • evaluate

        protected void evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
            Activator substrate,
            int evalThreadIndex,
            double[] fitnessValues,
            Behaviour[] behaviours)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT

        For fitness functions that define multiple fitness objectives (see BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount()) and/or behaviours for novelty search (see BulkFitnessFunctionMT.noveltyObjectiveCount()), evaluate an individual genotype over all of these objectives. This default implementation simply calls BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(Chromosome, Activator, int). If the fitness function defines a performance value then this method should call EvaluationData.setPerformanceValue(double). In a multi-objective set-up (see BulkFitnessFunctionMT.MULTI_KEY) only the performance defined by the primary fitness function will be used. If a performance value isn't defined it will be set to the (first) fitness value given by the primary fitness function.

        Note:This method may be called simultaneously by multiple threads (see BulkFitnessFunctionMT.MAX_THREADS_KEY), thus any state variables that may change during the course of an evaluation must be independent for each thread that calls this method. The parameter evalThreadIndex may be used to determine which thread is calling this method or more simply state variables can be instantiated within the method. The total number of threads is BulkFitnessFunctionMT.numThreads.

        Overrides:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        fitnessValues - An array to hold the fitness value(s) as determined by this fitness function. The array will have length BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount().
        behaviours - An array to hold the behaviour(s) for novelty search as determined by this fitness function. The array will have length BulkFitnessFunctionMT.noveltyObjectiveCount(), and can be safely ignored if this method returns 0.

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
            Activator substrate,
            java.lang.String baseFileName,
            boolean logText,
            boolean logImage)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        This method may optionally be overridden to perform an evaluation of an individual genotype and output the results to a log. The evaluation is not used for any purpose other than generating a record of the evaluation of the given genotype. This implementation will generate images for the novelty archive(s) if possible. If called multiple times in the same generation it will only generate images the first time. If overridden, subclasses should call this method from their own implementation.
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        baseFileName - The base/prefix of the names of log file(s) that should be created.
        logText - If true then text representations should be output.
        logImage - If true then image representations should be output.

      • _evaluate

        public void _evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
             Activator substrate,
             java.lang.String baseFileName,
             boolean logText,
             boolean logImage,
             double[] fitnessValues,
             Behaviour[] behaviours,
             java.util.List<com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.MDP.Environment> environments,
             int numEnvsToUseForEval)

      • evaluateGeneralisation

        public boolean evaluateGeneralisation(Chromosome genotype,
                             Activator substrate,
                             java.lang.String baseFileName,
                             boolean logText,
                             boolean logImage,
                             double[] fitnessValues)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        This method is akin to AHNIFitnessFunction.evaluateGeneralisation(Chromosome, Activator, String, boolean, boolean) but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple objectives. This method may optionally be overridden to perform an evaluation that performs a generalisation test of an individual genotype and output the results to a log. The generalisation test should use training examples or environments that are not used for fitness evaluations. The evaluation is not used for any purpose other than generating a record of the generalisation performance of the given genotype. The function should set the performance values and fitness values of the given Chromosome using the functions setFitnessValue(...) and setPerformanceValue(...).
        Overrides:
        evaluateGeneralisation in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        baseFileName - The base/prefix of the names of log file(s) that should be created.
        logText - If true then text representations should be output.
        logImage - If true then image representations should be output.
        fitnessValues - An array to hold the fitness value(s) as determined by this fitness function. The array will have length BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount().
        Returns:
        Implementations of this method must return true. This default implementation returns false to indicate that it's a dummy implementation.

      • noveltyObjectiveCount

        public int noveltyObjectiveCount()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        This is akin to BulkFitnessFunctionMT.getNoveltyObjectiveCount() but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple novelty objectives. Subclasses that support novelty search should override this method and return the number of behaviours this fitness function defines. This default implementation returns 0.
        Overrides:
        noveltyObjectiveCount in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        See Also:
        NoveltySearch, BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount()

      • fitnessObjectivesCount

        public int fitnessObjectivesCount()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        This is akin to BulkFitnessFunctionMT.getObjectiveCount() but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple objectives. This default implementation returns 1. If the fitness function defines more than one fitness objective, or no fitness objectives (eg only a novelty objective), then this method must be overridden to return the number of fitness objectives defined. NOTE: unlike BulkFitnessFunctionMT.getObjectiveCount() this method should not include the number of novelty objectives.
        Overrides:
        fitnessObjectivesCount in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        See Also:
        BulkFitnessFunctionMT.noveltyObjectiveCount()

      • objectiveLabels

        public java.lang.String[] objectiveLabels()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        This is akin to BulkFitnessFunctionMT.getObjectiveLabels() but allows for handling multiple fitness functions, some of which may define multiple fitness or novelty objectives. This default implementation returns an array containing BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount() + BulkFitnessFunctionMT.noveltyObjectiveCount() strings constructed of the class name of the sub-class prefixed with either F# or N# where F denotes a regular fitness objective, N denotes a novelty objective and # is the index of the objective.
        Overrides:
        objectiveLabels in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT

      • fitnessValuesStable

        public boolean fitnessValuesStable()
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        If the fitness value(s) and behaviour(s) for novelty search (if used) for this fitness function do not change between generations then subclasses should override this method to return true in order to avoid unnecessarily recalculating the fitness value(s) or behaviour(s). This default implementation returns false.
        Overrides:
        fitnessValuesStable in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        See Also:
        BulkFitnessFunctionMT.fitnessObjectivesCount()

      • ahniEventOccurred

        public void ahniEventOccurred(AHNIEvent event)
        Specified by:
        ahniEventOccurred in interface AHNIEventListener

      • getLayerDimensions

        public int[] getLayerDimensions(int layer,
                       int totalLayerCount)
        Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
        Sub-classes may override this to return the dimensions of the given layer.
        Overrides:
        getLayerDimensions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the dimensions of.
        totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the specified layer in the format [width, height] (0th index is width, 1st index is height). To specify a 1D layer or a layer that does not use a grid layout (see AHNIFitnessFunction.getNeuronPositions(int, int)) set the height to 1 and just specify the number of neurons in the layer via the "width". If the fitness function does not wish to define dimensions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.

      • getNeuronPositions

        public Point[] getNeuronPositions(int layer,
                         int totalLayerCount)
        Description copied from class: AHNIFitnessFunction
        Sub-classes may override this to return the locations of neurons in the given layer.
        Overrides:
        getNeuronPositions in class AHNIFitnessFunction
        Parameters:
        layer - The 0th based index of the layer to return the neuron locations for.
        totalLayerCount - The total number of layers in the substrate network. This can be used to determine, for example, if the output layer has been specified.
        Returns:
        The location of neurons in the specified layer. Coordinates should be supplied in the range [0, 1], HyperNEATTranscriber.RANGE_X and the corresponding Ranges for the x and y axes will be used to translate to the user specified coordinate ranges. If the layer is 2D then the locations should be specified in row packed order. If the fitness function does not wish to define neuron positions for the given layer then null may be returned. This default implementation returns null for all layers.
